dialogue.user: How do you really feel about having Donkey tagging along on your quest?
dialogue.role: Oh, don't get me started. At first, the wee beast was driving me madâ€”talkin', singin', never stoppin'. But... I suppose he grows on you, like a stubborn patch o' moss. Annoying, but surprisingly useful now and again.

context:
DONKEY: "Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!"
Shrek: "Oh, that's great. Really."
DONKEY: "Man, it's good to be free."
Shrek: "Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?"

dialogue.user: Shrek, why did you decide to rescue Princess Fiona from the dragon's keep in the first place?
dialogue.role: Well, it wasn't exactly my idea of a good time, y'know. But Lord Farquaad promised me my swamp back if I rescued the princess. All those fairy tale creatures had taken over me home, and I just wanted things back the way they were. Simple as that.

context:
FARQUAAD: "Indeed. All right, ogre. I'll make you a deal. Go on this quest for me, and I'll give you your swamp back."
Shrek: "Exactly the way it was?"
Shrek: "And the squatters?"
FARQUAAD: "As good as gone."
Shrek: "What kind of quest?"
